hints.content:
We can relate the image to multiplication and division:
$\color{color{blue}}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}} $
The image has $\color{green}30\color{black}$ total cheese triangles. [[image 0]] They are in $\color{blue}D6$ groups of $\color{purple}5$ cheese triangles.

$\color{blue}D6\text{ groups}\times ~\color{purple}5\text{  in each group}= \color{green}30\color{black}\text{ total}$
$\color{green}30\color{black}\text{ total }\div ~\color{purple}5\text{ in each group}= \color{blue}D6\text{ groups}$

Here is the completed table: | | | | |
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\color{blue}D6$| $\times$| $\fbox{\color{purple}5\color{black}$ | $=$ | $\color{green}30\color{black}$
$\color{green}30\color{black}$ |$\div$ | $\fbox{\color{purple}5\color{black}$ | $=$ | $\color{blue}D6$

question.content:
**Fill in the blanks to complete the table.**  
*Hint: Use the image to help you solve.* | | | | |
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$6$| $\times$ |  [] |$=$ | $30$
$30$ | $\div$ |   []   | $=$ | $6$ [[image 0]]

hints.content:
We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{color{blue}}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}} $
How many groups of $\color{purple}5$ do we need to make a total of $\color{green}35\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}D7$ groups of $\color{purple}5$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}+ \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}}_{\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}\color{purple}\text{ fives}}} = \color{green}35}$

$\color{blue}D7\times 5~=35$
$35\div\color{blue}D7=5$

Multiplication and division are related:
$\color{color{blue}}\text{number of groups}\color{black} \times \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $
$\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} \times \color{color{blue}}\text{number of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $

$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{color{blue}}\text{number of groups}\color{black} =\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} $
$\color{purple}\text{total}} \div \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}} =\color{color{blue}}\text{number of groups}}$

In this fact family, the $\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black}$ is $\color{purple}15\color{black}$.The $\color{color{blue}}\text{number of the groups}\color{black}$ is $\color{blue}E5$.The $\color{maroon}\text{size of each group}\color{black}$ is $\color{maroon}3$. [[image 0]]

So,
$\color{purple}15\color{black} = \color{maroon}3\color{black} \times \color{color{blue}}5\color{black}$
$\color{purple}15\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}5\color{black}=\color{maroon}3\color{black}$

These number sentences show the same relationship:-  $15 = 3\times5$
- $15\div5=3$

question.content: **Which equations show the same relationship as $5\times3=15$?**

hints.content: There are $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}$ rows.They are $\color{green}42\color{black}$ total bricks. [[image 0]] What is the $\color{purple}\text{size of the groups}}$?

We can write this as a multiplication problem. $\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{size of the group}\color{black}= \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$So, $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}} = \color{green}42}$

We can also write this as a division problem. $\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}42\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}7\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many bricks are in each row are:   - $\color{color{blue}}7\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}\color{black} = \color{green}42\color{black}$
 - $\color{green}42\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}7\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

question.content: Ella has built $7$ rows of the chimney for her house. She has used $42$ bricks. Each row has the same number of bricks.**Which equations would help us find out how many bricks are in each row?**

hints.content: There are $\color{color{blue}}4\color{black}$ friends.They got $\color{green}12\color{black}$ total carrots. [[image 0]] What is the $\color{purple}\text{size of the groups}}$?

We can write this as a multiplication problem. $\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{size of the group}\color{black}= \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$So, $\color{color{blue}}4\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}} = \color{green}12}$

We can also write this as a division problem. $\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$So, $\color{green}12\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}4\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many carrots Rhonda Rabbit gave each friend are:   - $\color{color{blue}}4\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{?}\color{black} = \color{green}12\color{black}$
 - $\color{green}12\color{black}\div \color{color{blue}}4\color{black}=\color{purple}\text{?}}$

question.content: Rhonda Rabbit found $12$ carrots to give to her $4$ friends.  She gave each friend the same number of carrots. **Which equations would help us find out how many carrots Rhonda Rabbit gave to each friend?**

hints.content:
We can relate the tape diagram to multiplication:
$\color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} \times \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} $
$\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} \times \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} = \color{purple}\text{total}\color{black}$
So, $\color{green}9\color{black}\times\color{maroon}6\color{black} = \color{purple}54}$ is one way to represent this image.

In this fact family, the $\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black}$ is $\color{purple}54\color{black}$.The $\color{green}\text{number of the groups}\color{black}$ is $\color{green}9$.The $\color{maroon}\text{size of each group}\color{black}$ is $\color{maroon}6$. [[image 0]]

We can also relate the tape diagram to division.
$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black} =\color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} $
$\color{purple}\text{total}\color{black} \div \color{maroon}\text{size of groups}\color{black} =\color{green}\text{number of groups}\color{black}$
So, $\color{purple}54\color{black} \div \color{green}9\color{black} = \color{maroon}6\color{black}$ is another way to represent this image.

Multiplication: $\color{green}9\color{black}\times\color{maroon}6\color{black}=\color{purple}54\color{black}$Division: $\color{purple}54\color{black} \div \color{green}9\color{black} = \color{maroon}6\color{black}$

question.content: **Which equations can the tape diagram represent?** [[image 0]]

hints.content:
We can relate multiplication and division:
$\color{color{blue}}\text{Number of groups}\color{black}\times\color{purple}\text{ size of the group}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$\color{purple}\text{Size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}\color{black}\div\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} =\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}$
$ \color{green}\text{Total}}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}}=\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}} $
If we have $\color{blue}D6$ groups, how many would need to be in each group to make a total of $\color{green}30\color{black}$?

There are $\color{blue}D6$ groups of $\color{purple}5$.$\underbrace{\color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}+\color{purple}5\color{black} + \color{purple}5\color{black}\color{black}_{\color{color{blue}}6\color{black}\color{purple}\text{ fives}}} = \color{green}30}$

$6\times  \color{purple}5~=30$
$30\div6=\color{purple}5$
Each row has $\color{purple}4$ plants.There are $\color{green}16\color{black}$ total plants. [[image 0]] How many $\color{color{blue}}\text{groups}}$ are there?

We can write this as a multiplication problem. $\color{purple}\text{size of the group}\color{black}\times\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} = \color{green}\text{ total}\color{black}$So, $\color{purple}4\times\color{color{blue}}\text{?}} = \color{green}16}$

We can also write this as a division problem. $\color{green}\text{total}\color{black}\div\color{purple}\text{ size of the groups}\color{black}=\color{color{blue}}\text{ number of groups}\color{black} $So, $\color{green}16\color{black}\div \color{purple}4=\color{color{blue}}\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many rows of tomato plants Olivia planted are: - $\color{purple}4\times\color{color{blue}}\text{?}\color{black} = \color{green}16\color{black}$ 
 - $\color{green}16\color{black}\div \color{purple}4=\color{color{blue}}\text{?}}$

question.content: Olivia planted $16$ tomato plants in rows in her new garden.  She planted $4$ plants in each row.  **Which equations would help us find out how many rows of tomato plants Olivia planted?**
